cookingMethod:
1. Boil pasta according to package instructions. 
2. In a pan, sauté garlic and onion in olive oil. 
3. Add tomato sauce and simmer for 10 minutes. 
4. Toss pasta with tomato sauce.

1. Preheat grill to medium-high heat. 
2. Season salmon fillet with salt, pepper, and olive oil. 
3. Grill for 5-7 minutes on each side, or until cooked to your liking. 
4. Squeeze lemon juice over the salmon before serving.

1. Marinate chicken in yogurt, garam masala, ginger, garlic, and lemon juice for at least 1 hour. 
2. Preheat oven to 450°F. 
3. Arrange chicken on a baking sheet and bake for 15-20 minutes, or until cooked through. 
4. In a pan, heat tomato sauce and add cooked chicken. 
5. Simmer for 10 minutes before serving.

1. Cook spaghetti according to package directions. 2. Brown ground beef in a large skillet over medium heat. 3. Add onion and garlic and cook until softened. 4. Add canned tomatoes, salt, and pepper, and simmer for 10 minutes. 5. Serve over spaghetti.

1. Grill chicken breast until cooked through. 2. Chop romaine lettuce into bite-sized pieces. 3. Toss lettuce with croutons, parmesan cheese, and Caesar dressing. 4. Slice chicken breast and add to the salad.

1. Cook egg noodles according to package directions. 2. Slice beef sirloin into thin strips. 3. Brown beef in a large skillet over medium heat. 4. Add onion and mushrooms and cook until softened. 5. Add beef broth and simmer for 10 minutes. 6. Remove from heat and stir in sour cream. 7. Serve over egg noodles.

1. Cook linguine according to package directions. 2. In a large skillet over medium heat, melt butter and sauté garlic until fragrant. 3. Add shrimp and cook until pink. 4. Squeeze in fresh lemon juice and sprinkle with salt and pepper. 5. Toss with cooked linguine and top with chopped parsley.

1. Cut chicken breast and vegetables into bite-sized pieces. 2. Thread onto skewers. 3. In a small bowl, mix olive oil, garlic, salt, and pepper. 4. Brush the mixture onto the skewers. 5. Grill for 10-12 minutes, turning occasionally, until chicken is cooked through and vegetables are tender.

1. In a large pot over medium heat, sauté onion, bell pepper, carrot, and celery until softened. 2. Add diced tomatoes, lentils, vegetable broth, chili powder, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper. 3. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 30-40 minutes, until lentils are tender. 4. Serve hot.
